pokedex_full.Sword: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
pokedex_full.Shield: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.

name: Weezing
pokedex: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.
pokedex_full.Yellow: It lives and grows by absorbing dust, germs and poison gases that are contained in toxic waste and garbage.
pokedex_full.Gold: If one of the twin KOFFING inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
pokedex_full.Silver: Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
pokedex_full.Ruby: WEEZING loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This POKéMON will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: WEEZING alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The POKéMON also becomes more putrid.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small KOFFING twins becoming conjoined as a WEEZING.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two KOFFING can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.
pokedex_full.Emerald: By diluting its toxic gases with a special process, the highest grade of perfume can be extracted. To WEEZING, gases emanating from garbage are the ultimate feast.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: If one of the twin KOFFING inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
pokedex_full.Black/White: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: Inhaling toxic fumes from trash and mixing them inside its body lets it spread an even fouler stench.
pokedex_full.X: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
pokedex_full.Y: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
pokedex_full.Sword: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
pokedex_full.Shield: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

name: Rhyhorn
pokedex: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
pokedex_full.Yellow: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges,  it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
pokedex_full.Gold: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_full.Silver: It doesn’t care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
pokedex_full.Ruby: RHYHORN runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This POKéMON may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: RHYHORN’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Strong, but not too bright, this POKéMON can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging TACKLES.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. Its TACKLE can knock a semitrailer flying.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Once it starts running, it doesn’t stop. Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it can’t remember why it started running in the first place.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
pokedex_full.Platinum: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: It doesn’t care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
pokedex_full.X: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.
pokedex_full.Y: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This Pokémon may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
pokedex_full.Sword: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
pokedex_full.Shield: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.

name: Rhydon
pokedex: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Walks on its hind legs. Shows signs of intelligence. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
pokedex_full.Gold: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.
pokedex_full.Silver: Its brain developed when it began walking on hind legs. Its thick hide protects it even in magma.
pokedex_full.Crystal: By lightly spinning its drill-like horn, it can easily shatter even a diamond in the rough.
pokedex_full.Ruby: RHYDON’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This POKéMON’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: RHYDON has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This POKéMON occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Its horn, which rotates like a drill, destroys tall buildings with one strike. It stands on its hind legs, and its brain is well developed.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
pokedex_full.Platinum: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Its brain developed when it began walking on hind legs. Its thick hide protects it even in magma.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
pokedex_full.X: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_full.Y: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Rhydon’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokémon’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
pokedex_full.Sword: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_full.Shield: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava’s heat by its tough, armorlike hide.

name: Chansey
pokedex: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
pokedex_full.Yellow: A gentle and kindhearted POKéMON that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured POKéMON.
pokedex_full.Gold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
pokedex_full.Silver: Few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the trainer who catches it.
pokedex_full.Crystal: People try to catch it for its extremely nutritious eggs, but it rarely can be found.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: CHANSEY lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch one.
pokedex_full.Emerald: CHANSEY lay nutritionally excellent eggs every day. The eggs are so delicious, they are eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_full.Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_full.Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won’t share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
pokedex_full.Platinum: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Being few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the Trainer who catches it.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokedex_full.X: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_full.Y: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_full.Sun: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
pokedex_full.Moon: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
pokedex_full.Sword: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
pokedex_full.Shield: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_full.Shining Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won’t share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured. These eggs are so nutritious that they’ve been nicknamed “doctors’ doubles.”
pokedex_full.Scarlet: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokedex_full.Violet: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

name: Tangela
pokedex: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick, blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
pokedex_full.Gold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
pokedex_full.Silver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_full.Crystal: During battle, it constantly moves the vines that cover its body in order to annoy its opponent.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: TANGELA’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Blue plant vines cloak the POKéMON’s identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. The vines sway as it walks.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Its vines snap off easily and painlessly if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by new growth the very next day.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
pokedex_full.Platinum: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_full.Black/White: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
pokedex_full.X: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
pokedex_full.Y: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
pokedex_full.Sword: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
pokedex_full.Shield: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they’re useful as a spice.

name: Kangaskhan
pokedex: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother’s protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother’s protective pouch until it is 3 years old.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won’t run from any fight to keep its young protected.
pokedex_full.Gold: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
pokedex_full.Silver: To protect its young, it will never give up during battle, no matter how badly wounded it is.
pokedex_full.Crystal: To avoid crushing the baby it carries in its pouch, it always sleeps standing up.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: If you come across a young KANGASKHAN playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby POKéMON’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.
pokedex_full.FireRed: The female raises its offspring in a pouch on its belly. It is skilled at attacking using COMET PUNCH.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother’s protective pouch until it is three years old.
pokedex_full.Emerald: If you come across a young KANGASKHAN playing by itself, never try to catch it. The baby’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: To protect its young, it will never give up during battle, no matter how badly wounded it is.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
pokedex_full.X: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
pokedex_full.Y: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokémon’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.
pokedex_full.Sun: Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.
pokedex_full.Moon: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: You shouldn’t get close to the child when it’s playing outside its mother’s pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won’t run from any fight to keep its young protected.
pokedex_full.Sword: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
pokedex_full.Shield: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets its baby out to play only when it feels safe to do so.

name: Horsea
pokedex: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_full.Yellow: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
pokedex_full.Gold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.
pokedex_full.Silver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When they’re in a safe location, they can be seen playfully tangling their tails together.
pokedex_full.Ruby: HORSEA eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: If HORSEA senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This POKéMON swims by cleverly flapping the fins on its back.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_full.Emerald: By cleverly flicking the fins on its back side to side, it moves in any direction while facing forward. It spits ink to escape if it senses danger.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its well-developed dorsal fin.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_full.X: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_full.Y: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
pokedex_full.Sword: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
pokedex_full.Shield: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits black ink and flees.

name: Seadra
pokedex: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
pokedex_full.Gold: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.
pokedex_full.Silver: Its fin-tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
pokedex_full.Crystal: The male raises the young. If it is approached, it uses its toxic spikes to fend off the intruder.
pokedex_full.Ruby: SEADRA sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this POKéMON’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: SEADRA generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This POKéMON weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_full.Emerald: The poisonous barbs all over its body are highly valued as ingredients for making traditional herbal medicine. It shows no mercy to anything approaching its nest.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Its fin-tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
pokedex_full.Black/White: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.
pokedex_full.X: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
pokedex_full.Y: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this Pokémon’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
pokedex_full.Sword: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
pokedex_full.Shield: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

name: Goldeen
pokedex: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.
pokedex_full.Yellow: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
pokedex_full.Gold: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_full.Silver: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots.
pokedex_full.Crystal: During spawning season, they swim gracefully in the water, searching for their perfect mate.
pokedex_full.Ruby: GOLDEEN is a very beautiful POKéMON with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this POKéMON - it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: GOLDEEN loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these POKéMON is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of “The Water Queen.”
pokedex_full.Emerald: In the springtime, schools of GOLDEEN can be seen swimming up falls and rivers. It metes out staggering damage with its single horn.
pokedex_full.Diamond: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
pokedex_full.Pearl: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
pokedex_full.Platinum: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots per hour.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_full.X: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
pokedex_full.Y: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokémon with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this Pokémon—it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Goldeen loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these Pokémon is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
pokedex_full.Sun: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
pokedex_full.Moon: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like fins has earned it the name “princess of the water.”
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
pokedex_full.Sword: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
pokedex_full.Shield: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
pokedex_full.Shining Pearl: It swims at a steady five knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.

name: Seaking
pokedex: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_full.Yellow: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
pokedex_full.Gold: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red.
pokedex_full.Silver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When autumn comes, the males patrol the area around their nests in order to protect their offspring.
pokedex_full.Ruby: In the autumn, SEAKING males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this POKéMON’s body coloration is at its most beautiful.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: SEAKING is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these POKéMON goes on for over a month.
pokedex_full.FireRed: The horn on its head is sharp like a drill. It bores a hole in a boulder to make its nest.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_full.Emerald: It punches holes in boulders on streambeds. This is a clever innovation that prevents its eggs from being attacked or washed away by the current.
pokedex_full.Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_full.Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
pokedex_full.Platinum: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, causing rivers to appear a brilliant red.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_full.X: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_full.Y: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokémon’s body coloration is at its most beautiful.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pokémon goes on for over a month.
pokedex_full.Sun: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
pokedex_full.Moon: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: To attract females, males dance on the river’s floor. The females gather around the male that dances most gracefully.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
pokedex_full.Sword: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_full.Shield: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. The Pokémon defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_full.Shining Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.

name: Staryu
pokedex: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
pokedex_full.Yellow: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
pokedex_full.Gold: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
pokedex_full.Silver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When the stars twinkle at night, it floats up from the sea floor, and its body’s center core flickers.
pokedex_full.Ruby: STARYU’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these POKéMON look like the stars in the sky.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: STARYU apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this POKéMON simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
pokedex_full.Emerald: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: At night, the middle of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_full.Black/White: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it’s torn apart.
pokedex_full.X: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_full.Y: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Staryu’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
pokedex_full.Sun: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
pokedex_full.Moon: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
pokedex_full.Sword: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
pokedex_full.Shield: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: If Staryu’s body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

name: Starmie
pokedex: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_full.Yellow: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in 7 colors.
pokedex_full.Gold: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
pokedex_full.Silver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It is said that it uses the seven-colored core of its body to send electric waves into outer space.
pokedex_full.Ruby: STARMIE’s center section - the core - glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this POKéMON has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
pokedex_full.Sapphire: STARMIE swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this POKéMON’s body glows in seven colors.
pokedex_full.FireRed: This POKéMON has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_full.Emerald: People in ancient times imagined that STARMIE were transformed from the reflections of stars that twinkled on gentle waves at night.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
pokedex_full.Black/White: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: Its core shines in many colors and sends radio signals into space to communicate with something.
pokedex_full.X: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_full.Y: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Starmie’s center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pokémon’s body glows in seven colors.
pokedex_full.Sun: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
pokedex_full.Moon: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.” This core can be made into high-priced accessories that are traded in secret.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.
pokedex_full.Sword: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
pokedex_full.Shield: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

name: Mr. Mime
pokedex: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Always practices its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn’t.
pokedex_full.Gold: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures.
pokedex_full.Silver: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It uses the mysterious power it has in its fingers to solidify air into an invisible wall.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: MR. MIME is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once it is believed, it will exist as if it were a real thing.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: If interrupted while it is miming, it will suddenly DOUBLESLAP the offender with its broad hands.
pokedex_full.Emerald: A MR. MIME is a master of pantomime. It can convince others that something unseeable actually exists. Once believed, the imaginary object does become real.
pokedex_full.Diamond: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
pokedex_full.Pearl: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
pokedex_full.Platinum: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
pokedex_full.X: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
pokedex_full.Y: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming. If you don’t act impressed, it will attack you with a double slap!
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Always practices its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn’t.
pokedex_full.Sword: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
pokedex_full.Shield: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
pokedex_full.Shining Pearl: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.

name: Scyther
pokedex: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
pokedex_full.Gold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_full.Silver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It’s very proud of its speed. It moves so fast that its opponent does not even know what knocked it down.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: SCYTHER is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This POKéMON’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of itself.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes. The scythes can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.
pokedex_full.Platinum: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective coloration makes it invisible.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
pokedex_full.X: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
pokedex_full.Y: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_full.Sun: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
pokedex_full.Moon: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: Some call it a ninja. Its movements— imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave the air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
pokedex_full.Sword: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
pokedex_full.Shield: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey’s attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon’s nimble motions.
pokedex_full.Scarlet: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_full.Violet: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

name: Jynx
pokedex: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
pokedex_full.Gold: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
pokedex_full.Silver: It speaks a language similar to that of humans. However, it seems to use dancing to communicate.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It has several different cry patterns, each of which seems to have its own meaning.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: JYNX walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_full.Emerald: A JYNX sashays rhythmically as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without noticing.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: It speaks a language similar to that of humans. However, it seems to use dancing to communicate.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
pokedex_full.X: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_full.Y: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
pokedex_full.Sword: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
pokedex_full.Shield: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

name: Electabuzz
pokedex: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
pokedex_full.Yellow: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this POKéMON has eaten electricity at a power plant.
pokedex_full.Gold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
pokedex_full.Silver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When two ELECTABUZZ touch, they control the electric currents to communicate their feelings.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this POKéMON compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
pokedex_full.Emerald: When a storm approaches, it competes with others to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
pokedex_full.Platinum: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
pokedex_full.Black/White: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
pokedex_full.X: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
pokedex_full.Y: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_full.Sun: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
pokedex_full.Moon: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Electricity permeates its body. It swings its arms round and round to charge up electricity before unleashing a punch.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: While it’s often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
pokedex_full.Sword: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
pokedex_full.Shield: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

name: Magmar
pokedex: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
pokedex_full.Gold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
pokedex_full.Silver: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It moves more frequently in hot areas. It can heal itself by dipping its wound into lava.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: In battle, MAGMAR blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This POKéMON’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly amidst flames.
pokedex_full.Emerald: In battle, it blows out intense flames from all over its body to intimidate its foe. These fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in the area.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_full.Platinum: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
pokedex_full.Black/White: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: The scorching fire exhaled by Magmar forms heat waves around its body, making it hard to see the Pokémon clearly.
pokedex_full.X: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_full.Y: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
pokedex_full.Sun: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
pokedex_full.Moon: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: The hotter the place, the better they feel. Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than those in other areas.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
pokedex_full.Sword: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
pokedex_full.Shield: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It was born in the crater of a volcano. Its body is covered with flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.

name: Pinsir
pokedex: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It can’t move if it’s cold, so it lives in warm places.
pokedex_full.Gold: With its horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.
pokedex_full.Silver: Swings its long antlers wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
pokedex_full.Crystal: When the temperature drops at night, it sleeps on treetops or among roots where it is well hidden.
pokedex_full.Ruby: PINSIR is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This POKéMON’s movements turn sluggish in cold places.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: PINSIR has a pair of massive horns  Protruding from the surface of these horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into the foe’s body when the pincer closes, making it tough for the foe to escape.
pokedex_full.FireRed: Its two long pincer horns are powerful. Once they grip an enemy, they won’t release until the foe is torn.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: If it fails to crush the foe in its pincers, it will swing around and toss the opponent.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Their pincers are strong enough to shatter thick logs. Because they dislike cold, PINSIR burrow and sleep under the ground on chilly nights.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: With its pincer horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
pokedex_full.Black/White: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.
pokedex_full.Black 2/White 2: It grips prey with its powerful pincers and will not let go until the prey is torn in half.
pokedex_full.X: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.
pokedex_full.Y: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Pinsir is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This Pokémon’s movements turn sluggish in cold places.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Pinsir has a pair of massive horns. Protruding from the surface of these horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into the foe’s body when the pincer closes, making it tough for the foe to escape.
pokedex_full.Sun: It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them apart. Although it is a powerful Pokémon, it can’t deal with the cold.
pokedex_full.Moon: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: It gets into territorial disputes with Vikavolt. For some reason, it apparently gets along well with Heracross in Alola.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: Although it’s tough, it can’t handle cold well. When night falls, it buries itself in leafage and sleeps.
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It can’t move if it’s cold, so it lives in warm places.
pokedex_full.Sword: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
pokedex_full.Shield: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn apart. What it can’t tear, it tosses far away.

name: Tauros
pokedex: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokedex_full.Yellow: A rowdy POKéMON with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won’t stop until it hits something.
pokedex_full.Gold: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
pokedex_full.Silver: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_full.Crystal: These violent POKéMON fight with other members of their herd in order to prove their strength.
pokedex_full.Ruby/Sapphire: This POKéMON is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_full.FireRed: When it is about to TACKLE, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokedex_full.Emerald: It is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_full.Diamond/Pearl/Platinum: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokedex_full.X: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_full.Y: When it is about to tackle, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire: This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_full.Sun: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
pokedex_full.Moon: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: The climate seems to be related to the reason Tauros in Alola are a little calmer than those in other regions.

pokedex_full.Sword: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
pokedex_full.Shield: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl: Once it takes aim at its prey, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokedex_full.Scarlet: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokedex_full.Violet: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.

name: Magikarp
pokedex: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.
pokedex_full.Gold: An underpowered, pathetic POKéMON. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
pokedex_full.Silver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like PIDGEOTTO to catch it mid-jump.
pokedex_full.Crystal: This weak and pathetic POKéMON gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
pokedex_full.Ruby: MAGIKARP is a pathetic excuse for a POKéMON that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: MAGIKARP is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy POKéMON that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic POKéMON in the world.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_full.Emerald: Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is easily washed away by currents. In places where water pools, you can see many MAGIKARP deposited there by the flow.
pokedex_full.Diamond: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
pokedex_full.Pearl: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
pokedex_full.Platinum: A MAGIKARP living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but usually not more than seven feet.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like PIDGEOTTO to catch it mid-jump.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedex_full.X: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedex_full.Y: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedex_full.Alpha Sapphire: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedex_full.Sun: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
pokedex_full.Moon: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
pokedex_full.Ultra Sun: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.
pokedex_full.Ultra Moon: Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water doesn’t bother them at all. They live in waters all over the world!
pokedex_full.Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.
pokedex_full.Sword: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedex_full.Shield: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
pokedex_full.Brilliant Diamond: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
pokedex_full.Shining Pearl: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
pokedex_full.Legends: Arceus: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
pokedex_full.Scarlet: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
pokedex_full.Violet: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: Gyarados
pokedex: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

pokedex_full.Red/Blue: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
pokedex_full.Yellow: Brutally vicious and enormously destructive. Known for totally destroying cities in ancient times.
pokedex_full.Gold: They say that during past wars, GYARADOS would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
pokedex_full.Silver: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
pokedex_full.Crystal: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
pokedex_full.Ruby: When MAGIKARP evolves into GYARADOS, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this POKéMON’s wildly violent nature.
pokedex_full.Sapphire: Once GYARADOS goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn’t calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this POKéMON’s rampages lasting a whole month.
pokedex_full.FireRed: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The HYPER BEAM it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
pokedex_full.LeafGreen: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
pokedex_full.Emerald: It is an extremely vicious and violent POKéMON. When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.
pokedex_full.Diamond: Once it appears, its rage never settles until it has razed the fields and mountains around it.
pokedex_full.Pearl: In ancient literature, there is a record of a GYARADOS that razed a village when violence flared.
pokedex_full.Platinum: Once it begins to rampage, a GYARADOS will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
pokedex_full.HeartGold: They say that during past strife, GYARADOS would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
pokedex_full.SoulSilver: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
pokedex_full.Black/White/Black 2/White 2: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
pokedex_full.X: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.

pokedex_full.Omega Ruby: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokémon’s wildly violent nature.
